abstract: Adds a context menu to a tab.

declaration.code: nonisolated func contextMenu<M>(@ViewBuilder menuItems: () -> M) -> some TabContent<Self.TabValue> where M : View

overview:
## Return Value

A row that can display a context menu.

## Discussion

Use this modifier to add a context menu to a tab’s sidebar representation. Compose the menu by returning controls like [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Button], [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Toggle] and [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Picker] from the `menuItems` closure. You can also use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Menu] to define submenus, or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Section] to group items.

The following example adds the ability to pin the tab or share the tab’s books with a friend.
title: contextMenu(menuItems:)
